attributes.action: Tax payer free entry to tax funded tourist sights
attributes.additional_details:
Tax payers should be allowed entry to tax funded sights and exhibits in the UK free of charge, because they have already contributed to their up keep, and have the right to view and enjoy them without paying heavy price tags.

Many countries award this, but in the UK, many tax payers are forced to queue and pay  to see such sights like, The Tower of London, St Paul's, etc behind the rest of the world, when the have the right to enjoy their own heritage free of charge.
